thread.title: MLB team has perfect Twitter response to Chris Christie's rant
thread.title_full: MLB team has perfect Twitter response to Chris Christie's rant

author: Sam Laird
title: MLB team has perfect Twitter response to Chris Christie's rant
text:
Just when you thought he was off the radar, Chris Christie is back making new friends.
Just kidding.
SEE ALSO: Get to know this NBA rookie now ‚Äî you'll be talking about him all weekend
Christie ‚Äî who is still governor of New Jersey after a brief stint playing Reek on the new American reality show Trump of Thrones ‚Äî was a Wednesday night guest on SportsNet New York . He was his usual charming self.
Here's what Christie had to say about the Philadelphia Phillies and their fans when asked about the team using the slogan "Ya gotta believe," which actually has roots with the New York Mets.
The Phillies suck. Let's just start with that, OK? They're from Philadelphia, they're an awful team, they're an angry, bitter fan base and it's not safe for civilized people to go to Citizens Bank Park if you want to root for the other team. Ya gotta believe what? Ya gotta believe we're awful people. That's what ya gotta believe.
‚ÄúThe Phillies suck. They are an awful team, they are an angry bitter fanbase‚Äù ‚Äî @GovChristie
Full Video: https://t.co/yAopMXw7nm pic.twitter.com/6ovUPPkemF
‚Äî SportsNet New York (@SNYtv) February 16, 2017
Governor Christie with the flaming hot take! The guy should be a sports blogger.
Really, however, he just set himself for this scathing reply from the Phillies on Twitter.
We love our fans and appreciate their unwavering support as we "bridge" to a bright future!
‚Äî Phillies (@Phillies) February 16, 2017
That tweet is, of course, referring to " Bridgegate ," the scandal that not so long ago engulfed Christie's office.
The Phillies' snappy comeback was warmly received by the Twitter peanut gallery.
@Phillies pic.twitter.com/L72flyy7aL
‚Äî C. James Philly (@cjamesPhilly) February 16, 2017
@Phillies pic.twitter.com/Cu2Zq7oZgr
‚Äî Joe Giglio (@JoeGiglioSports) February 16, 2017
@Phillies pic.twitter.com/hc6VGcI20K
‚Äî Zachary D. Rymer (@zachrymer) February 16, 2017
@Phillies pic.twitter.com/JVE7FDp9pa
‚Äî Steve Golden üìé (@NatsBankruptcy) February 16, 2017
I mean, come on. Everyone knows Philadelphia sports fans are so nice .
